steps.title: Plan your space.
steps.content: Plan your space. A standard, to-scale floor plan drawing will suffice for plotting out exactly where you want to install wall cabinets.

steps.title: Determine if your floor is level.
steps.content: Determine if your floor is level.

steps.title: Measure and make a mark 54 inches (137 cm) from the floor.
steps.content: Measure and make a mark 54 inches (137 cm) from the floor. If your floor is not level, measure from the highest point of the floor.

steps.title: Draw a horizontal line at your mark.
steps.content: Draw a horizontal line at your mark. Use a level to ensure a straight and level line for hanging wall cabinets.

steps.title: Find the wall studs using a stud finder.
steps.content: Find the wall studs using a stud finder. Mark the stud locations along the horizontal hanging line.

steps.title: Secure ledger board along the hanging line.
steps.content: Secure ledger board along the hanging line. The ledger board will support your cabinets during installation. Screw the ledger board into the wall at the stud locations.

steps.title: Remove all doors, handles and knobs from the cabinets.
steps.content: Remove all doors, handles and knobs from the cabinets. This will ensure the lightest possible load while you hang wall cabinets.

steps.title: Clamp together as many cabinets as you can safely lift.
steps.content: Clamp together as many cabinets as you can safely lift. Use clamps to adjoin side-by-side vertical cabinet walls. Once they are clamped together, make sure the cabinet faces are flush.

steps.title: Connect the cabinets.
steps.content: Connect the cabinets. Pre-drill then screw the adjoining cabinets together in 4 places ï¿½ 2 on the top and 2 on the bottom, on the far right and far left sides.

steps.title: Lift the cabinets and rest them on the ledger board in their designated place.
steps.content: Lift the cabinets and rest them on the ledger board in their designated place. Check that they are level and plumb before moving on to the next step.

steps.title: Pre-drill then screw the cabinets into the wall studs.
steps.content: Pre-drill then screw the cabinets into the wall studs. Be sure to screw through the thick framing along the top of the cabinets.

steps.title: Check for plumb and level after hanging wall cabinets and before moving on to hanging the next set of cabinets.
steps.content: Check for plumb and level after hanging wall cabinets and before moving on to hanging the next set of cabinets.

steps.title: Repeat this process for each cabinet until all wall cabinets are hung.
steps.content: Repeat this process for each cabinet until all wall cabinets are hung.

steps.title: Replace all the cabinet doors and hardware after you completely install wall cabinets.
steps.content: Replace all the cabinet doors and hardware after you completely install wall cabinets.
